name: Frequently Asked Questions - PB Serum Enzymes

mainEntity.name: What are PB Serum enzymes and how do they work?

acceptedAnswer.text:
PB Serum is an advanced medical treatment based on recombinant enzymes that degrade localized fat, improve skin firmness, and reduce fibrosis.
It uses three key enzymes: lipase (to reduce fat), collagenase (to improve elasticity), and hyaluronidase (to decrease fibrosis and fluid retention).

acceptedAnswer.text:

  • âœ… Arms and thighs: Eliminates localized adiposity and improves firmness.

mainEntity.name: How many sessions are needed to see results?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The number of sessions varies according to the treated area and the individual response of the patient.
Generally, between **3 and 6 sessions** are recommended, with intervals of 15 to 30 days between each one.
First results can be appreciated after the second session, and continuous improvement in subsequent weeks.

mainEntity.name: How is the recovery after a PB Serum treatment?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The treatment does not require rest, but slight inflammation and redness may appear in the treated area for 24 to 48 hours.
It is fundamental to avoid direct sun exposure and use sunscreen on treated areas.

mainEntity.name: Does the application of PB Serum enzymes hurt?

acceptedAnswer.text:
The procedure may generate a sensation of slight burning or pressure in the area, but it is well tolerated.
In some cases, topical anesthesia is used for greater patient comfort.

mainEntity.name: How long do PB Serum results last?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Results can be maintained for a long time if accompanied by a balanced diet and regular physical activity.
However, as aging and metabolism continue, a maintenance session every 6 to 12 months is recommended.

mainEntity.name: What is the difference between PB Serum and other localized fat treatments?

acceptedAnswer.text:
PB Serum acts directly on fat, without need for surgery or prolonged recovery times.
Unlike cryolipolysis or cavitation, which destroy fat cells by cold or ultrasound, PB Serum enzymes degrade fat through biochemical processes, achieving a progressive and natural reduction.

mainEntity.name: Is PB Serum a safe treatment?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Yes, it is a safe treatment when applied by trained professionals.
The enzymes used are biocompatible and act selectively on adipose tissue without affecting other structures.
